intro: Stylidium nonscandens, commonly known as the pink stickseed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Stylidium nonscandens is adapted to survive in harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
